strapiGuide.title: NWA Daily's Guide to Coffee Shops in Fayetteville, AR
strapiGuide.description: Looking for the best coffee shops in Fayetteville, Arkansas? Look no further! From cozy small-town vibes at Red Kite Company to late-night options at Lift Coffee Bar, we've got you covered with a list of the top coffee shops in the area. Whether you're in need of a quick caffeine fix or a place to work or relax, these locally-owned coffee shops offer something for everyone. Check out our list and find your new favorite spot for a cup of joe in Fayetteville.
strapiGuide.content:
Feel like you don't know all the best coffee shops in Fayetteville? Look no further, because Fayetteville, Arkansas has some seriously amazing options for your caffeine fix. From cozy spots to work or hang out with friends, to late night weekend hangouts and even a drive-thru option, there's something for everyone. And let's not forget about the delicious food options - avocado toast, breakfast tacos, and even waffles! So whether you're a local or just passing through, make sure to check out these amazing Fayetteville coffee shops for a truly memorable caffeine experience.

Fayetteville

Onyx Coffee Lab

üìç2418 N. Greg Ave.

Photo courtesy of Onyx

The OG - Onyx's Fayetteville location is where it all started. It is a great, quick spot for a cup of quality coffee and a reflection back at Onyx's humble beginning. Zero frills and strictly good coffee.

Instagram - Facebook


Puritan Coffee & Beer

üìç205 W Dickson St

Puritan is your classic modern coffee shop with plenty of space to sit and work or play games with friends. It is in a perfect location on the top of Dickson Street with a great selection of beers and ciders too. They have a legendary trivia night!

Instagram - Facebook


Red Kite Company

üìç1852 N Crossover Rd

Photo courtesy of Red Kite

A super cozy coffee shop that sells exclusively Onyx coffee. A great place to study or just hang out on the east side of town. Rumor is their expanding to Benton County soon so keep an eye out as Red Kite plans to make some moves!

Facebook


Old Pine

üìç3775 Mall Ave

Photo courtesy of Old Pine

Located on a spur of the Razorback Greenway, Old Pine is a cozy spot and traditionally quieter as its a bit further from campus. On a beautiful morning their outdoor patio is the place to be. The avocado toast is a solid choice - we would recommend.

Instagram - Facebook


Arsaga's

üìç481 S. School Ave

üìç200 W. Center St.

üìç1509 MLK Jr. Blvd

üìç401 W. Mountain St.

With 4 locations in Fayetteville each Arsaga's location is a different experience. Take your friends to the Mill District and have a fancy breakfast or brunch with your coffee in an artsy cafe. Church & Center is calm and comfy, and of course Carsaga's is perfect for a quick one to-go. The fourth location just reopened and can be found in the Fayetteville Public Library.

Instagram - Facebook


Basecamp

üìç2850 N College Ave

Photo courtesy of Basecamp

Originally known as Mama Carman's, now Basecamp is an open and spacious place off College with plenty of places to sit to work or catch up with a friend. They have the classic toast and pastry options too.

Instagram - Facebook


Doomsday Coffee & Roasterie

üìç436 W Watson St

Photo courtesy of Doomsday

Located off West Street near downtown Fayetteville, Doomsday Coffee is owned and operated by veterans with REALLY tasty breakfast and lunch tacos. They're open 7 days a week for breakfast and lunch and are often overlooked, but shouldn't be.

Instagram - Facebook


Lift Coffee Bar

üìç3959 N Steele Blvd

Photo courtesy of Lift

Located in uptown Fayetteville, Lift Coffee Bar helps meet the caffeine cravings of north Fayetteville. Open late on weekends, this is an ideal location for coffee nightcap. Definitely go with an empty stomach so you can try their delicious menu items. The waffles are great!

Instagram - Facebook


Locals Drive Thru Coffee

üìç2626 E Citizens Dr

Photo courtesy of Locals Drive Thru Coffee

Locals Drive Thru Coffee serves locally roasted, specialty coffee with speed and convenience. Locals has a mission to treat everyone in such a way that they "leave better." You can get any quality coffee and specialty drink, just a little faster, and know you're contributing to a hyper local business. When you go, try the cinnamon toast crunch latte!

Instagram - Facebook

Whether you're looking for a cozy spot to study or a quick caffeine fix on the go, Fayetteville has plenty of options for coffee lovers. From the classic Onyx Coffee Lab to the trendy Lift Coffee Bar, there's something for everyone's taste. Don't forget to try some of the local roasters, like Doomsday Coffee and Locals Drive Thru Coffee, for a truly unique experience. With so many great options, it's easy to find your perfect cup of coffee in Fayetteville.
